sentences.en: " I wouldn't make a nuisance of myself!'said Miss Sun.
sentences.cn: 孙小姐道: “ 我才不讨人厌呢!

sentences.en: A public nuisance was one which damaged a large number of persons.
sentences.cn: 公害是造成许多人受害.

sentences.en: Back in the 1980s drug users were a public nuisance in Zurich.
sentences.cn: 在20世纪80年代，吸毒者在苏黎世是被众人所唾弃的。

sentences.en: He could be a bit of a nuisance when he was drunk.
sentences.cn: 他喝醉时会是一个有点令人讨厌的人。

sentences.en: He was always a devil of a nuisance.
It is a nuisance the way it keeps on blowing.
sentences.cn: 风总是这么刮,真伤脑筋.

sentences.en: It's a blooming nuisance because it frightens my dog to death.
sentences.cn: 它真让人讨厌，快把我的狗吓死了。
那只狗是经常惹人讨厌的东西.

sentences.en: The dog is a terrible nuisance.
The drunk was making a nuisance of himself and so the manager threw him out on his ear.
sentences.cn: 那醉汉自己招人讨厌,因此经理不客气地把他打发走了.

sentences.en: The nightclub has been declared a public nuisance.
sentences.cn: 那家夜总会已被判定为妨害公众利益。
他们真是十足的讨厌鬼。

sentences.en: Too much luggage is a nuisance.
sentences.cn: 行李带的多了,是个累赘.

sentences.en: What a nuisance that child is!
What a nuisance! It'seems the rain will never stop.
sentences.cn: 真要命, 雨像是不会停了.

sentences.en: You're a nuisance sometimes, but we love you just the same.
sentences.cn: 你有时令人讨厌, 但我们仍然爱你.

phrases.tran_cn: n. 妨害公众安宁；妨害公众利益的人或事物

trans.tran_cn: 讨厌的东西（人，行为）麻烦事，非法妨害，损害，麻烦事
trans.tran_en: a person, thing, or situation that annoys you or causes problems
